name: Feral Grin
description: With a snarl or glare, the Ajaba forces her opponent to back down, unnerved. A hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Finishing Blow
description: A merely wounded enemy is an enemy that can still fight; dead, they can do no more harm. This Gift, taught by a lion-spirit, helps the Ajaba finish their kills.

name: Burning the Vision
description: The Midnight can etch a moment into another's memory, ensuring that they can never forget so much as a single detail of what they see or hear. This Gift, taught by a servant of Helios, is often used at the scenes of terrible atrocities against Gaia.

name: Tears of the Heavens
description: Raising their arms and reciting a spontaneous poem, the Ajaba calls down the rain. A sky-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Laughter in the Night
description: Like any good hyena, the Ajaba is much more dangerous once the sun goes down  and far bolder in taking prey. A night-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Crushing Jaws
description: Only death can loose the Ajaba's jaws. By using this Gift together as a group, several Ajaba can pull apart even the mightiest opponent. A hyena-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Bless the Rains
description: The Ajaba composes words of thanks to the rain falling around them, complimenting it for sharing its bounty with the dry Earth. The rains respond with generosity. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Scavenge
description: The Ajaba may safely consume and digest any physical object they can get into their mouth, from carrion to pistols to toxic waste: their jaws can chew it, and their stomach can process it. A goat-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Shadows of the Serengeti
description: As the Ajaba sings a song of their fallen Kin, their shadows rise from the dust of the earth to lend their strength to their cause. A night-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Laughter of the Soul
description: The Ajaba's barking chuckle worms into enemies' minds, becoming a harbinger of terror and madness. Fear-spirits teach this Gift.

name: Culling the Weak
description: The Ajaba use the strength Gaia granted them to mark the weak  and then allow their enemies' very weakness to prepare them for the slaughter. This Gift is taught by a vulture-spirit.

name: Bitter Tears
description: Standing in the pouring rain, the Ajaba composes a spontaneous poem expressing their sorrow at Gaia's fallen state; the intensity of the rain redoubles, and it carries some measure of their sadness. An ancestor-spirit teaches this Gift.

name: Becoming the Night Jester
description: Though this Gift offers no power during the day, by night the Dusk's Crocas form takes on an aspect of ancient nocturnal terror  a primal, red-eyed, and black-furred hyena the size of a polar bear. Hyena herself teaches this Gift.

name: Echoes of the Asamando
description: Powerful Ajaba of the Dusk learn dark roads to victory, gleaning wisdom from voices most would quail to hear. This Gift, taught by an ancestor-spirit, allows the Ajaba to speak and be heard by the dead  and to hear their voices in return.

name: Rain of Doom
description: Standing in the rain, the Ajaba points to a man-made object or building and spits insults and curses at it, expressing their rage and disdain. The rain acts as acid when it strikes the structure. A pain-spirit teaches this Gift.
